Title.evidence: Prophylactic Transanal Irrigation in Preventing Low Anterior Resection Syndrome: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: patients who underwent ultralow rectal resection were randomised

Participants.evidence: patients who underwent ultralow rectal resection

Intervention.evidence: randomised to TAI or control with supportive therapy

Objective.evidence: evaluated the prophylactic effect of transanal irrigation (TAI) in preventing LARS symptoms

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the maximum number of defaecation episodes during the day at 1 month.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was stratified by centre and anastomosis type, with allocation via an online minimization program.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Thirty-nine patients were randomised between February 2016 and April 2018; 18 to TAI and 19 to control.

Result_Outcome.evidence: TAI significantly reduced daytime defaecation episodes (median 3 vs. 7, p=0.003) and nighttime episodes (0 vs. 3, p=0.001).
